item.title: Beth add a quote by Vincent Willem van Gogh
item.description: "If you hear a voice within you say <i>you cannot paint,</i> then by all means paint and that voice will be silenced." -- Vincent Willem van Gogh

item.title: Beth add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I believe a strong woman may be stronger than a man, particularly if she happens to have love in her heart. I guess a loving woman is indestructible." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Beth add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Beth add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "One may have a blazing hearth in one's soul and yet no one ever came to sit by it. Passers-by see only a wisp of smoke from the chimney and continue on their way." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Beth add a quote by Vincent van Gogh
item.description: "At present I absolutely want to paint a starry sky. It often seems to me that night is still more richly coloured than the day; having hues of the most intense violets, blues and greens. If only you pay attention to it you will see that certain stars are lemon-yellow, others pink or a green, blue and forget-me-not brilliance. And without my expatiating on this theme it is obvious that putting little white dots on the blue-black is not enough to paint a starry sky." -- Vincent van Gogh

item.title: Beth add a quote by Vincent van Gogh
item.description: "I am seeking, I am striving, I am in it with all my heart." -- Vincent van Gogh

item.title: Beth add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "If you truly love nature, you will find beauty everywhere." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Beth add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "I am still far from being what I want to be, but with God's help I shall succeed." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Beth add a quote by Vincent van Gogh
item.description: "The beginning is perhaps more difficult than anything else, but keep heart, it will turn out all right." -- Vincent van Gogh

item.title: Beth add a quote by Vincent Willem van Gogh
item.description: "I want to touch people with my art. I want them to say <i>'he feels deeply, he feels tenderly'</i>." -- Vincent Willem van Gogh

item.title: Beth add a quote by Vincent van Gogh
item.description: "I can't change the fact that my paintings don't sell. But the time will come when people will recognize that they are worth more than the value of the paints used in the picture." -- Vincent van Gogh

item.title: Beth add a quote by Vincent van Gogh
item.description: "When I have a terrible need of - shall I say the word - religion, then I go out and paint the stars." -- Vincent van Gogh

item.title: Beth add a quote by Vincent van Gogh
item.description: "The sunflower is mine, in a way." -- Vincent van Gogh

item.title: Beth add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "If one feels the need of something grand, something infinite, something that makes one feel aware of God, one need not go far to find it. I think that I see something deeper, more infinite, more eternal than the ocean in the expression of the eyes of a little baby when it wakes in the morning and coos or laughs because it sees the sun shining on its cradle." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Beth add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I wonder how many people I've looked at all my life and never seen." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Beth add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "All great and precious things are lonely." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Beth add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Try to understand men. If you understand each other you will be kind to each other. Knowing a man well never leads to hate and almost always leads to love." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Beth add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "And this I believe: that the free, exploring mind of the individual human is the most valuable thing in the world. And this I would fight for: the freedom of the mind to take any direction it wishes, undirected. And this I must fight against: any idea, religion, or government which limits or destroys the individual. This is what I am and what I am about." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Beth add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "What good is the warmth of summer, without the cold of winter to give it sweetness." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Beth add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "To be alive at all is to have scars. " -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Beth add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "There's more beauty in truth, even if it is dreadful beauty." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Beth add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "We can shoot rockets into space but we can't cure anger or discontent. " -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Beth add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Thoughts are slow and deep and golden in the morning." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Beth add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "There are two ways to get enough. One is to continue to accumulate more and more. The other is to desire less." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Beth add a quote by Chesterton, G. K. (Gilbert Keith)
item.description: "There is the great lesson of 'Beauty and the Beast,' that a thing must be loved before it is lovable." -- Chesterton, G. K. (Gilbert Keith)

item.title: Beth add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "It is absurd for the Evolutionist to complain that it is unthinkable for an admittedly unthinkable God to make everything out of nothing, and then pretend that it is more thinkable that nothing should turn itself into everything." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Beth add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "Once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Beth add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description:
"I carry your heart with me (I carry it in my heart)I am never without it (anywhere I go you go,my dear; and whatever is done by only me is your doing,my darling) I fear no fate (for you are my fate,my sweet)I want no world (for beautiful you are my world,my true) and it's you are whatever a moon has always meant and whatever a sun will always sing is you
here is the deepest secret nobody knows (here is the root of the root and the bud of the bud and the sky of the sky of a tree called life; which grows higher than the soul can hope or mind can hide) and this is the wonder that's keeping the stars apart
I carry your heart (I carry it in my heart)" -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Beth add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Hope is the thing with feathers That perches in the soul And sings the tune without the words And never stops at all." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Beth add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The world is indeed full of peril, and in it there are many dark places; but still there is much that is fair, and though in all lands love is now mingled with grief, it grows perhaps the greater." -- J.R.R. Tolkien
